intro: Trigonotis clavata, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy, and it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. Trigonotis clavata is typically found in alpine or subalpine habitats, where it adapts to cold and dry conditions. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant for rock gardens and alpine collections.
